clinical_study.brief_title: A Clinical Trial Evaluating the Efficacy of Ultra Low Dose of Decitabine in Myelodysplastic Syndromes (MDS)
clinical_study.official_title: Prospective, Open, Multi-center, Double Arm Clinical Trial Evaluating the Efficacy of Ultra Low Dose of Decitabine in Myelodysplastic Syndromes (MDS)

lead_sponsor.agency: The First Affiliated Hospital with Nanjing Medical University

clinical_study.source: The First Affiliated Hospital with Nanjing Medical University

brief_summary.textblock: To evaluate the safety and clinical efficacy of ultra-low-dose decitabine in Chinese MDS

detailed_description.textblock: To develop a highly effective and safe protocol, a multi-center, prospective clinical trial was conducted in China, with aims to evaluate the grade III and IV hematologic toxicity and clinical efficacy of subcutaneous injection of ultra-low-dose decitabine (5 to 7 mg/m2) for treatment of myelodysplastic syndrome (MDS), while decitabine at a dose of 20 mg/m2 as a control.

primary_outcome.measure: Grade III and IV hematologic toxicity, according to National Cancer Institute common toxicity criteria (NCI-CTC) V3.0 criteria

secondary_outcome.measure: Complete response, according to International Working Group (IWG) response criteria
Complete response (CR) rate of bone marrow, according to IWG response criteria
Partial response (PR) rate, according to IWG response criteria
Hematologic improvement (HI), according to IWG response criteria
Overall response rate, defined as CR＋PR＋HI, according to IWG response criteria
Cytogenetic response, according to IWG response criteria

secondary_outcome.description: times of transfusion requirements during 8 months after enrollment
times of hospitalization during 8 months after enrollment

secondary_outcome.measure: The quality of life, the quality of life will be assessed by European Organization for Research and Treatment of Cancer Quality of Life Questionnaire C30 (EORTC QLQC30)

arm_group.description: decitabine was subcutaneously administered at 5 to 7 mg/m2 once daily for successive 3 days at the first week, and once daily at weeks 2 to 4, with a total dose of 60 mg in a 4-week cycle.
decitabine was subcutaneously given at 20 mg/m2 once daily for successive 3 days, with a total dose of 60 mg/m2 in a 4-week cycle.
